title: 2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Electoral (Amendment)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Electoral (Amendment) 

Regulations 2025.

title: 2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby
heading: 2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby
text_raw:
2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby 

amended by: - 

(a) 

the substitution of the following regulation for regulation 8: 

“8. A specified document for the purposes of section 111 of 
the Electoral Act 1992 shall be: 

(i) 

a passport; 

(ii) 

a driving licence; 

(iii) an employee 

identity card containing a 

photograph; 

(iv) 

(v) 

(vi) 

 a student identity card issued by an educational 
institution and containing a photograph; 

travel document containing name and 

a 
photograph; 

 a Bank or Savings or Credit Union book 
containing address in constituency or local 
electoral area; 

(vii) a Public Services Card; 

(viii) a cheque book; 

(ix) a debit card or credit card; 

(x) 

a birth certificate; 

(xi) a marriage certificate. 

Items (viii) to (xi) shall be accompanied by a further document 
which establishes the address of the holder in the constituency 
or local electoral area.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 25th July, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [361] 3 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 16 July 2025 

JAMES BROWNE, 
 Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [361]

title: 2. The Electoral Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 156 of 2007) are hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

In these regulations the list of identifications which a voter may be required to 
produce at a polling station is amended to replace ‘cheque card’ with ‘debit 
card’. 

 
 
 
 
 [361] 5
